snippet: The job of personal trainer is one of the fastest-growing occupations in the United States, despite the challenges of uneven regulation, irregular hours and low pay.
abstract: Personal training is one of the fastest-growing occupations in the United States, despite the challenges of uneven regulation, irregular hours and low pay; number of personal trainers grew by 44 percent, to 231,500, from 2001 to 2011 (Series: The New American Job).
lead_paragraph: The job of personal trainer is one of the fastest-growing occupations in the United States, despite the challenges of uneven regulation, irregular hours and low pay.

headline.seo: For Personal Trainers, a Boom Fueled by a Belt-Tightening Age
headline.main: A Jobs Boom Built on Sweat in an Age of Belt-Tightening
headline.print_headline: A Jobs Boom Built on Sweat In an Age of Belt-Tightening
